title: Rumer Willis emulates Marie Antoinette in elaborate corset dress at Halloween bash
text:
She usually steps out in her signature laid-back ensembles.

But Rumer Willis pulled out all the stops as she attended a Halloween party with her sister Scout at private members' club San Vicente Bungalows in West Hollywood, California, on Saturday evening.

The actress, 31, channelled the last Queen of France, Marie Antoinette, for her outing as she sported a busty corset dress, which featured detailed floral print and lace embroidery.

Kooky display: Rumer Willis (L) pulled out all the stops as she attended a Halloween party with her sister Scout (R) at San Vicente Bungalows in West Hollywood, California, on Saturday

Mixing 18th century chic with current style trends, the Once Upon a Time in Hollywood star complemented her elaborate mini-dress with white fishnet tights, gold lace-up boots and a pale pink handbag.

The Empire actress maintained her kooky display with her hair and make-up as she sported a heavily-applied blusher and a black wig with ringlet curls.

Scout, 28, meanwhile, opted for a slightly more demure look in a quirky black gown, complete with a sweetheart neckline and puffball sleeves.

Busty babe: The actress, 31, channelled Marie Antoinette for her outing as she sported a busty corset dress, which featured detailed floral print and lace embroidery

The real deal: The last queen of France ruled the European country before the French Revolution

Smitten: Jonah Hill was also pictured at the starry venue with his new fiancée Gianna Santos

Earlier in the week, their mother Demi Moore hinted her ex-husband and their father Bruce Willis 'didn't deserve' to get paid more than her in 1991's Mortal Thoughts.

The American actress, 56, shocked the audience on Wednesday's instalment of The Late Late Show by naming a male co-star who she believed didn't deserve to get paid more than her.

After being praised for her work when it came to gender disparity in Hollywood during a game of Spill Your Guts or Fill Your Guts, the actress, 56, was asked by James Corden on which one of her former male co-stars didn't deserve a bigger paycheck than her.

Famous family: Rumer, Scout, and their sister Tallulah, 25, are the children of screen stars Demi Moore and Bruce Willis - who were married from 1987 until 2000

Desperately trying to worm her way out of drinking hot sauce, Demi - who has starred alongside the likes of Woody Harrelson, Patrick Swayze and Michael Douglas - surprisingly answered: 'I'd say Bruce Willis.'

She offered some context to her upcoming answer: 'OK, I don't know if I could say he didn't deserve. That's not necessarily up to me to say...

'I'd say Bruce Willis,' she revealed of her ex-husband, 64, who she was married to from 1987 to 2000, and starred with in 1991's Mortal Thoughts.

Demi, who has made a series of shock revelations in her new memoir Inside Out, then tried to backtrack: 'No, I can't say that he didn't deserve it.'

However, James wasn't buying the friendly exes jargon, quipping back: 'Well, then you're not answering the question!'

Succumbing to the pressure of giving a real answer, Demi was then forced down the shot of hot sauce.

Demi was married to Bruce from 1987 until 2000 and the pair are parents to three children - Rumer, Scout, and Tallulah, 25.
description: The actress, 31, pulled out all the stops as she attended a Halloween party with her sister Scout, 28, at private members' club San Vicente Bungalows in Hollywood, California, on Saturday.
